article.headline: Boston U. 73, Stony Brook 68
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Kevin Gardner scored a career-high 27 points and Corey Hassan added 22 as Boston University beat Stony Brook 73-68 on Sunday. Gardner shot 9-of-14 from the field and 9-of-12 from the line to help the Terriers sweep the season series with the Seawolves, who lost their sixth straight. Hassan hit five 3-pointers. Boston University (10-15, 7-7 America East) led by as many as 12 in the second half, but Antwan Hardy scored 16 of his 20 points in the half, including a 3-pointer with 39.8 seconds to play, to pull Stony Brook within 69-68. The Terriers' Brian Macon sank two free throws with 25.9 seconds left and Mike Popoko missed a potential game-tying 3-pointer. Hassan made two more free throws in the closing seconds. Popoko scored 16 points for the Seawolves (4-21, 2-12). After Hardy's tipin gave Stony Brook a 27-25 lead with 3:44 remaining in the first half, Boston University closed the half on a 9-0 run to take a 34-27 halftime lead. Hassan's 3-pointer with 3:16 remaining in the half gave the Terriers the lead for good, 28-27. Gardner capped the stretch with a free throw in the closing seconds of the half.
